newsitem.title: USA: ADR REPORT - Norsk Hydro slips in New York.
newsitem.headline: ADR REPORT - Norsk Hydro slips in New York.

text.p: American Depositary Receipts (ADRs) in Norwegian industrial conglomerate Norsk Hydro fell on Monday, hit by a decline in 1996 profits.
Trade in most ADRs was quiet as investors waited for Federal Reserve chairman Alan Greenspan's Humphrey-Hawkins testimony this week in Congress.
"The emphasis is on the U.S. market," a trader said. "There are a lot of people sitting on their hands."

ADRs in Norsk Hydro, Norway's largest listed company, fell 3-3/4 to 52-3/8 in moderate volume after the company posted a 10 percent decline in operating profits last year. The chief financial officer said he expected 1997 net profits would be about the same as in 1996.
Britain's Hanson Plc rocketed 15-3/4 to 22-7/8 after it completed its breakup with the spinoff of its Energy Group. China Eastern Airlines Corp rose 2-3/8 to 20-3/8.
Among Latin American ADRs, Telefonos de Mexico rose 1/8 to 40-1/8.
Advancers led decliners by 234 to 211 among 807 ADRs. Volume was 24 million shares in late morning.
